group.label: General Settings
group.comment: Enhance the overall performance and user experience of your helpdesk by setting up core features such as how communication is managed, personalizing customer interactions, and ensuring smooth ticket management with automated tasks.

field.label: Helpdesk title in the customer account
field.comment: Customize the title displayed for the Helpdesk section in the customer's account to create a clear and branded support experience.

field.label: Sign staff replies
field.comment: Adds a personal touch to customer communication, which helps personalize responses and provide clarity on who handled the support request increasing trust and transparency.

field.label: Signature template
field.comment: You can use variables: [store_name], [user_name], [department_name]

field.label: Send blind carbon copy (BCC) of all emails to
field.comment: Automatically send a BCC of all helpdesk-related emails to a specified address for monitoring or record-keeping, helping ensure nothing gets overlooked.

field.label: Use default Magento cron
field.comment: Enable magento cron to ensure scheduled actions like email fetching are handled efficiently without extra configuration.
field.tooltip: If this option is disabled, helpdesk-related tasks will not be processed automatically. For instance, emails from the configured gateway will not be fetched. However, you can still manually trigger cron tasks to test the module's functionality.

field.label: Allow customer to open ticket by unique URL (without additional authentication)
field.comment: Customers will receive link in the email notification to access their support tickets via a unique URL, simplifying the process and increasing accessibility by eliminating extra login steps.

group.label: Tickets Settings
group.comment: Manage the flow and organization of support tickets efficiently by controlling the prioritization, categorization, and statuses of incoming customer requests. This section ensures that support agents can handle tickets based on urgency and track progress seamlessly.

field.label: Priority for new tickets
field.comment: Set the default priority for new tickets to help organize and prioritize customer issues based on urgency.

field.label: Status for new tickets
field.comment: Define the default status for new tickets to give clear visibility of ticket progress.

field.label: Move Ticket to Archive if it has one of following statuses:
field.comment: Automatically move tickets to the archive when they reach specified statuses, ensuring the system stays organized.

field.label: Lock Ticket if it has one of following statuses:
field.comment: Control when tickets are locked based on their statuses to avoid further changes once certain progress is made.
field.tooltip: When ticket is locked the customer cannot add a new message to the ticket, while admin still can send messages

field.label: Tickets autosave period, sec
field.comment: Set how frequently ticket drafts are autosaved, minimizing the risk of losing unsaved work. Leave empty to disable autosave.

field.label: Use WYSIWYG Editor in backend
field.comment: Enable the use of a text editor for tickets in the backend, making it easier for staff to format replies and provide detailed, structured responses.

field.label: Create Tickets from Contact Us form
field.comment: Automatically create helpdesk tickets from submissions via the 'Contact Us' form, turning every inquiry into a manageable support ticket.

group.label: Admin Display Options
group.comment: Improve the visual accessibility and ease of navigating through tickets in the admin panel. This section allows you to enable quick access to essential data, helping your support team handle tickets faster and more effectively.

field.label: Show Quick Data Bar in admin ticket grid
field.comment: This feature enhances workflow visibility and helps agents stay on top of their responsibilities.

field.label: Show User Activity Data Bar in admin ticket grid
field.comment: Shows recent user activity related to the ticket, helping managers track staff interactions with customers more efficiently.

field.label: Show previous/next button in backend ticket edit page
field.comment: Display 'previous' and 'next' buttons on the ticket editing page in the backend to move through tickets quickly without returning to the grid.

group.label: Attachments Settings
group.comment: Customize how file attachments are managed within the helpdesk. This section helps you control the storage, format, and retention of attachments, ensuring customers and staff can exchange relevant files without compromising storage space.

field.label: Store attachments in
field.comment: Select the storage location for ticket attachments, giving you control over file management.

field.label: Auto-removing old attachments
field.comment: Enable automatic removal of old attachments to free up storage space and keep the system clutter-free

field.label: Remove attachments older than, days
field.comment: Specifies the number of days after which old ticket attachments will be deleted.

field.label: Only allow upload of attachments with extensions
field.comment: Restrict attachment uploads to specific file types to avoid security risks and maintain control over the type of files uploaded. Comma separated list. e.g. jpg, jpeg, gif, png, bmp, pdf>

group.label: Feedback Tab
group.comment: Boost customer engagement by offering an easy-to-use feedback system. The feedback tab allows customers to submit inquiries or tickets directly from the website, improving accessibility to your support team.

field.comment: Activate the feedback tab on your website, making it easy for customers to submit support requests.
field.label: Enable Feedback Tab
Assign to Department
field.comment: Automatically assign feedback tab-generated tickets to a specific department, ensuring they reach the right team for quick resolution.

field.label: Tab Color
field.comment: Customize the feedback tab color to align with your brand, making it more visually appealing and noticeable.

field.label: Tab Title
field.comment: Set the title for the feedback tab, giving customers a clear call to action

field.label: Tab Position
field.comment: Choose where the feedback tab is displayed on the screen, ensuring it's easily accessible

field.label: Search Knowledge Base Topics first
field.comment: Allow the feedback tab to suggest knowledge base topics before showing the form, helping reduce support ticket volume by guiding customers to self-help resources.

group.label: Form Fields
group.comment: Tailor the feedback submission forms to collect the right information from customers. This section lets you customize form fields and improve the accuracy of the information gathered from customers, enhancing the quality of support requests.

field.label: Form Title
field.comment: Set a title for the feedback form to provide context and guide customers on what to expect.

field.label: Subject Title
field.comment: Label the subject field to ensure customers provide a brief overview of their issue.

field.label: Subject Placeholder
field.comment: Placeholder text displayed inside the subject input field that provides guidance on what kind of information the customer should enter.

field.label: Description Title
field.comment: Label the description field to prompt customers to provide more details about their inquiry.

field.label: Description Placeholder
field.comment: Add helpful placeholder text to guide customers in providing relevant information.

field.label: Allow customer to attach files
field.comment: Enables the option for customers to upload files (e.g., screenshots or documents) with their feedback or support request providing additional context or supporting materials for their issue.

field.label: Allow customers to select Priority
field.comment: Gives customers the ability to set the priority of their feedback or ticket that can help the support team to prioritize urgent requests over less critical ones.

field.label: Allow customer to select Department
field.comment: Allows customers to choose the department their request should be sent to. This ensures that inquiries are routed to the correct team for faster handling.

group.label: Customer Account
group.comment: Improve customer experience by integrating helpdesk functionality into the customer’s account. This section helps you enable features like tracking ticket status, prioritizing requests, and allowing file attachments, making the support process more user-friendly.

field.label: Show the Help Desk section in the Customer Account
field.comment: Display a Help Desk section in the customer’s account, making it easy for customers to submit and track their support tickets directly from their account dashboard.

field.label: Show Help Desk link in customer menu
field.comment: Add a Help Desk link in the customer's dropdown menu for quick access to the support page, ensuring customers can easily find the help they need.

field.label: Allow customers to select Priority
field.comment: Let customers the ability to set the priority of the ticket that can help the support team to prioritize urgent requests over less critical ones.

field.label: Allow customer to select Department
field.comment: Allows customers to choose the department their request should be sent to. This ensures that inquiries are routed to the correct team for faster handling.

field.label: Allow customer to select Order
field.comment: Allows customers to link their support tickets to particular orders they have placed, helping support staff to address issues more efficiently.

field.label: Allow customer to attach files
field.comment: When enabled, customers can upload files with their ticket submissions, providing additional context or supporting materials for their issue.

group.label: Customer Satisfaction Survey
group.comment: Gain valuable insights into customer satisfaction with your support. This section allows you to include surveys in your communications and view the results, helping you continually improve your service based on real feedback.

field.label: Include a satisfaction survey in the reply email from staff members
field.comment: Automatically include a satisfaction survey in staff reply emails to encourage feedback and measure customer satisfaction with the support they received.

field.label: Show survey results in the frontend ticket history
field.comment: Allow customers to view their survey ratings in the ticket history within their account, giving them transparency on how they rated their interaction with support.

field.label: Show survey results in the backend ticket history
field.comment: Provide support staff access to customer satisfaction ratings in the backend, allowing them to review and address feedback for service improvement.

field.label: Send survey results to the ticket owner
field.comment: Notify the assigned staff member when a customer submits a satisfaction survey, giving them the opportunity to review their performance.

field.label: Send survey results to emails
field.comment: Automatically send customer satisfaction survey results to designated email addresses (e.g., managers) for analysis and performance tracking. You can enter multiple emails separated by a comma.

group.label: Email Notification Settings
group.comment: Ensure efficient communication between your support team and customers by configuring how and when email notifications are sent. This section helps automate key touchpoints, keeping all parties informed about ticket statuses.

field.label: Show Ticket ID in the email title
field.comment: Include the ticket ID in the subject line of helpdesk-related emails, making it easy for both customers and staff to reference specific tickets in ongoing conversations.

field.label: Add customers Cc emails to the ticket
field.comment: When enabled will automatically add additional email recipients (Cc) to the ticket from the fetched email. If option is enabled spam Cc email are possible.

field.label: Number of last replies to be shown in the ticket history
field.comment: Control how many recent replies are displayed in the ticket history within email notifications, providing context without overwhelming the recipient with too much information.

group.label: Email Notification Templates
group.comment: Streamline your email communication with customers and staff by setting notification templates. This section ensures that each email interaction is consistent and professional, keeping everyone aligned with support activities.

field.label: Template of New Ticket Email for Customer
field.comment: Set the email template that notifies customers when a new ticket is created, ensuring consistent branding and communication.

field.label: Template of New Ticket Email for Staff
field.comment: Set the template for the email notifying staff about new tickets, ensuring timely alerts and a professional look.

field.label: Template of Ticket Email Assigned to Staff
field.comment: Set the email template used when a ticket is assigned to a staff member, ensuring they are informed of their new task promptly.

field.label: Template of New Message Email for Customer
field.comment: Set the template for emails that update customers when a new message is posted to their ticket, ensuring they stay informed about progress.

field.label: Template of New Message Email for Staff
field.comment: Set the template to alert staff when a customer responds, ensuring timely follow-ups.

field.label: Template of New Message Email for Third Party
field.comment: Set the template for notifying third-party collaborators, ensuring external stakeholders stay updated on the ticket progress.

field.label: Template of Ticket Reminder
field.comment: Set the template for reminder emails, prompting customers to follow up on unresolved tickets.

field.label: Template of Rule Notification
field.comment: Set a rule-specific template for automated emails sent via helpdesk workflow rules, ensuring consistency in communications.

field.label: Template of Survey Satisfaction Result
field.comment: Set the template used to send staff survey feedback results, providing insights into customer satisfaction.

group.label: Desktop Notification Settings
group.comment: Keep your staff informed in real time with desktop notifications about new tickets and updates. This section enables instant awareness of new tasks, helping the support team act quickly and stay organized.

field.label: Notifications check period, sec
field.comment: Adjusting the frequency helps staff stay updated in real-time, ensuring timely follow-ups.
field.tooltip: On heavy-loaded systems, this can cause production loss - so in this case, you need to disable this feature, or increase the check period to 500-600 secs. Setting to 0 will disable them.

field.label: Show notification about arrival of new tickets for
field.comment: Allows you to specify which users should receive notifications about the arrival of new tickets, ensuring the right team members are alerted promptly.

field.label: Enable notification about arrival of new messages in tickets assigned for user
field.comment: Notifies users about a new message is added to any ticket that they are assigned to, helping them stay informed on ticket updates.

field.label: Enable notification about assigning a ticket to the user
field.comment: Sends a notification to users when a ticket is assigned to them, ensuring they are aware of their new responsibilities.

group.label: Working Hours
group.comment: Set clear expectations for customers by displaying your business hours. This section helps customers know when they can expect support availability, enhancing the overall customer experience and ensuring timely responses.

field.label: Working schedule title
field.comment: Customize the title for the working hours section on the 'Contact Us' page, ensuring customers know when your team is available.

field.label: Upcoming working schedule title
field.comment: Add a title for upcoming business hours, providing customers with clear information on future availability.

field.label: Default message when we are open
field.comment: Set a default message to display when the helpdesk is open, encouraging customers to reach out during business hours.
field.tooltip: Can be overwritten for each schedule in Customers > Help Desk MX > Working Hours. This allows you to provide customized messages for different time periods or scenarios, depending on the specific schedule of your support team.

field.label: Default message when we are closed
field.comment: Define the message displayed when the helpdesk is closed managing customer expectations during off-hours.
field.tooltip: Can be overwritten for each schedule in Customers > Help Desk MX > Working Hours. You can use the variable [time_left_to_open] to specify exactly how much time remains until your support team is available again.

field.label: Show online/offline status on the Contact Us page
field.comment: Display the status on the Contact Us page that can help manage customer expectations about when support is available.

field.label: Show online/offline status in the Feedback popup
field.comment: Display the status in the Feedback popup that can be useful for informing customers about availability before submitting a request or feedback.

field.label: Show online/offline status in the Customer Account > My Tickets
field.comment: Display the status in the My Tickets section of the customer's account. This help customers know whether they can expect a prompt response to their support ticket.

field.label: Show working hours on the Contact Us page
field.comment: Display the status on the Contact Us page to give customers a clear idea of when you are available for support

field.label: Show holiday schedule in X days before activation
field.comment: Specifies how many days in advance your holiday schedule will be displayed to customers to ensure that customers are informed about upcoming holiday hours before they take effect

group.label: Reports
group.comment: Track the performance of your helpdesk with reporting on solved tickets. This section allows you to define which ticket statuses are considered solved, helping you monitor team efficiency and customer service success.

group.label: Developer Settings
group.comment: Optimize the technical aspects of the helpdesk system with developer-specific options. This section helps in testing, debugging, and customizing the module to suit your website's infrastructure without disrupting live operations.

field.label: Activate Sandbox
field.comment: Enable sandbox mode to test the helpdesk system without affecting live data. All emails will be redirected to the sandbox email, preventing disruptions to real customer interactions.

field.label: Send All Outgoing emails to Email
field.comment: Set an email address to receive all outgoing emails in sandbox mode, ensuring a controlled environment for testing email templates and notifications.

field.label: Force store's theme to apply styles
field.comment: If theme overrides Magento way of including style this option will add Help Desk styles to page

field.label: Log ticket deletion
field.comment: Keep a log of deleted tickets to track deletions and maintain a record for audit or recovery purposes, stored in the /var/log/mirasvit/helpdesk.log file.

field.label: Help Text
field.comment: Add customizable help text that appears under the title on the 'Contact Us' page and Feedback tab, providing customers with clear guidance on how to submit a support request.

field.label: Show customer the local time in backend
field.comment: Display the customer’s local time in the backend to help support staff understand when the customer submitted the ticket, providing context for time-sensitive issues. To ensure the option works correctly, you need to download a timezone database.

field.label: Path to GeoLite2 City database
field.comment: Used for determining a customer timezone. You can download it here https://dev.maxmind.com/geoip/geoip2/geolite2/. Please enter a full absolute path to the file. E.g. /var/lib/GeoLite2-City.mmdb.

field.label: Enable Google reCaptcha
field.comment: Activate Google reCaptcha on Helpdesk pages to prevent spam and bots from submitting fraudulent tickets. Configuration for reCaptcha settings is available in Configuration > Security > Google reCaptcha.
